Pre-Game Insights: New India vice-captain Shubman Gill expressed dissatisfaction with his T20I batting performance leading up to the match against Sri Lanka.
Gill highlighted his contrasting performance in ODIs and T20Is, noting his average of 29.7 and strike rate of 139.5 in T20Is.
He emphasized his goal to improve his T20I form in the upcoming cycle, aiming to contribute to the team's success.
Gill discussed his role as vice-captain, stating it would not hinder his batting performance but would require him to make more decisions on the field.
He expressed confidence in his communication and understanding with new T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Gill mentioned his enjoyment of batting with Yashasvi Jaiswal, highlighting their right-left combination and strong partnership.
The article noted the retirements of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, signaling a new era for India's T20I team.
